fields.name: Pie 2 Side by side
fields.template:
{% extends "base.html" %} {% load chartkick %} {% block content %}

Django Graph Pages

This template displays two pie charts side by side in a fluid grid.

{{ title1 }}

{% pie_chart data1 with id='chart-1' %}

{{ title2 }}

{% pie_chart data2 with id='chart-2' %}
{% endblock content %}
fields.description: Chartkick two pie charts side by side with title1, data_1, title2, & data_2

fields.name: Top 20 countries by land area column
fields.query:
title = 'Top 20 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:20]
data = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

fields.name: Top 20 countries by land area pie chart
fields.query:
title = 'Top 10 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:10]
data = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

fields.name: Top 10 countries by land area and population
fields.query:
title1 = 'Top 10 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:10]
data1 = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

title2 = 'Top 10 countries by population'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-population')[:10]
data2 = [[o.name, o.population] for o in r]
fields.description: Top 20 countries by land area and population

fields.name: Top 10 countries by land area and population 2
fields.query:
title1 = 'Top 10 countries by land area'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-land_area')[:10]
data1 = [[o.name, o.land_area] for o in r]

title2 = 'Top 10 countries by population'
r = CIA.objects.order_by('-population')[:10]
data2 = [[o.name, o.population] for o in r]
fields.description: Top 20 countries by land area and population side by side
